10/22/2025 THE DALLES, Ore. – Today, Google and the City of The Dalles celebrated the completion of a new water infrastructure project that will increase the region’s water capacity for decades to come.  The Aquifer Storage and Recovery System is part of Google’s $28 million investment to support the City’s public water system. The company recently expanded its…
The post Google advances commitment to The Dalles, launching sustainable water storage system appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: Google advances commitment to The Dalles, launching sustainable water storage system

articles.author: Jim Teece
articles.description:
The recent, multi-hour outage at Amazon Web Services (AWS) on Monday, October 20, 2025, served as a stark and costly reminder of how profoundly the global digital economy relies on a few core infrastructure providers. What began as a technical issue in a single US region—specifically, the crucial US-EAST-1 data center in Virginia—quickly cascaded into…
The post The Single Point of Failure: Analyzing the Latest AWS Outage appeared first on Southern Oregon Business Journal.
articles.title: The Single Point of Failure: Analyzing the Latest AWS Outage

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: U.S. Bank will close its Drain branch on January 15, 2026. Officials say the move reflects a shift toward digital banking, with no disruption to customer accounts. The nearest branch will be in Cottage Grove. U.S. Bank also plans to close its Mill City branch days earlier on January 12.
articles.title: U.S. Bank to Close Drain Branch in January 2026

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg School Board has approved up to $95,000 to add private changing and shower areas to Roseburg High School’s locker rooms. The upgrades aim to improve student comfort and privacy, with plans for individual stalls and enclosed spaces funded through the district’s 404 infrastructure fund.
articles.title: Roseburg School Board Prioritizes Funding for Locker Room Privacy Upgrades

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Goin’ Postal has opened a new Roseburg location at 2210 Stewart Parkway, now called Goin’ Postal Hobbies & More. The store combines shipping services with toys, collectibles, and games at bargain prices. A grand opening sale offers $139.99 mailboxes through the end of the month.
articles.title: Goin’ Postal Hobbies & More Opens New Roseburg Location

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A new Holiday Inn Express on Northwest Mulholland Drive in Roseburg is nearly complete. The 100-room hotel, featuring an indoor pool, is expected to open in January as part of the Hanna Heritage Place development, expanding Roseburg’s hospitality and retail offerings.
articles.title: New Holiday Inn Express Nearing Completion in Roseburg

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Receiver Morning Scoop
articles.title: October 23, 2025

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The Roseburg Police Department will host National Drug Take Back Day on Friday, Oct. 24, 2025, from 8 a.m.–12 p.m. and 1–5 p.m. at 700 SE Douglas Ave. Residents can safely and anonymously dispose of unwanted or expired medications. Illicit substances will not be accepted.
articles.title: Roseburg Police to Host National Drug Take Back Day on October 24

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Lookingglass Rural Fire District has purchased its first-ever cardiac monitor thanks to $22,500 in community donations from the Cow Creek Band of Umpqua Tribe of Indians and the Ford Family Foundation. The new equipment will improve local emergency response and cardiac care.
articles.title: Lookingglass Fire District Secures Cardiac Monitor Through Community Donations

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Roseburg’s annual leaf pickup runs Nov. 3–Dec. 31. Crews will start in Laurelwood Park and move clockwise through the city, collecting leaves to keep drains clear. Residents should pile leaves at the edge of their property. Updates: Roseburg Public Works website or 541-492-6730.
articles.title: Roseburg Kicks Off Annual Leaf Collection in November

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: Downtown Roseburg is seeing new growth as two businesses prepare to open. The Majestic Theater and Big Picture Cafe will bring indie films and global flavors to SE Main St., while The Beckham Group relocates its real estate office to SE Jackson St., purchasing the building outright.
articles.title: New Additions Coming to Downtown Roseburg: The Majestic Theater and The Beckham Group

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: The National Weather Service warns of heavy rain, mountain snow, and gusty winds from Friday through Monday. Coastal areas could see dangerous surf, and drivers should watch for ponding on roads. Officials urge the public to rely on trusted NWS forecasts, not social media posts.
articles.title: NWS: Heavy Rain, Mountain Snow, and Wind Expected Across the Pacific Northwest

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A series of storms will soak the Pacific Northwest starting Thursday night as an atmospheric river brings 2–6 inches of rain to western Oregon and Washington. Snow levels will drop to 2,500–3,000 feet by the weekend. Clear drains and prepare for minor flooding in low-lying or urban areas.
articles.title: Atmospheric River to Drench the Pacific Northwest: Clear Gutters and Drains

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man is in jail on $50,000 bail after a reported robbery and struggle with police. Raul Yanz Rosario, 41, is accused of robbing a 19-year-old of his wallet and later injuring an officer during his arrest near Fir Grove Park. He faces multiple felony and assault charges.
articles.title: Teen robbed at knifepoint, officer injured

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: A Roseburg man narrowly escaped after his home on Fisher Road caught fire Tuesday morning. Jim Barnes was asleep with earplugs in and woke only when passersby banged on his door. Central Douglas Fire & Rescue arrived within minutes, but the home and a nearby RV were already engulfed.
articles.title: Roseburg Fire Destroys Home on Fisher Road

articles.author: Joseph Ziegler
articles.description: An 18-year-old Yoncalla student was arrested after allegedly bringing a gun to school earlier this month. Taylor Haydon Larson was released on the condition he stay away from campus. He faces two weapons charges after a video showing a pistol in a school bathroom led to his arrest.
articles.title: Teen Released After Allegedly Bringing Gun to Yoncalla High School

articles.author: News Staff
articles.description: A natural gas line rupture on Southeast Pine Street prompted swift action by firefighters on Monday, according to the Roseburg Fire Department.
articles.title: Natural gas leak in Roseburg prompts evacuations and traffic detours
